hedline.hl1: 7 Airlines Give an Inch For Middle Passenger

abstract.p: Seven foreign airlines widen middle seats on Airbus jets (S)

block.p: Seven foreign airlines have made a small change on their single-aisle Airbus jets to ease that feeling of being squeezed into a middle seat. Those middle seats -- designated B and E on the six-across economy-class seating layouts -- are now 20 inches wide, one inch wider than the aisle and window seats.
The carriers with wider middle seats are Air France, All Nippon Airways, Asiana Airlines, Austrian Airlines, British Airways, China Southern Airlines and Lufthansa.

Seven foreign airlines have made a small change on their single-aisle Airbus jets to ease that feeling of being squeezed into a middle seat. Those middle seats -- designated B and E on the six-across economy-class seating layouts -- are now 20 inches wide, one inch wider than the aisle and window seats.
The carriers with wider middle seats are Air France, All Nippon Airways, Asiana Airlines, Austrian Airlines, British Airways, China Southern Airlines and Lufthansa.

The wider seats are possible because the single-aisle Airbus jets -- the A-318, A-319 and A-320 -- are seven inches wider than the competing Boeing 737. The seven airlines use the other five inches for wider aisles, which allows people to squeeze past the food carts.
None of the American airlines that fly these Airbus jets have installed the wider middle seats.
